snippet: When Jackson, Miss., said goodbye to Mayor Chokwe Lumumba this weekend, blacks and whites, for a change, largely united in mourning.
abstract: City of Jackson, Miss, says goodbye to Mayor Chokwe Lumumba, who died in February at age 66; Lumumba won office despite a radical past and found support from both the black and white communities for his pragmatic policies; although it is clear that Lumumba was attempting to move a city ravaged by decades of poverty, crime and white flight in the right direction, what is less clear is what comes next for the city.
lead_paragraph: When Jackson, Miss., said goodbye to Mayor Chokwe Lumumba this weekend, blacks and whites, for a change, largely united in mourning.

headline.main: Jackson Mourns Mayor With Militant Past Who Won Over Skeptics
headline.print_headline: Jackson Mourns Mayor With Militant Past Who Won Over Skeptics
